meanings.definition: Persuaded to do something by deception or force.
meanings.sent1: She was seduced into believing his lies.
meanings.sent2: The villain seduced the hero into joining forces.
meanings.sent3: The tricky fox seduced the rabbit into a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The sly salesman seduced the customer into buying the unnecessary product.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic music seduced the listeners into a trance.

meanings.definition: Attracted or enticed by charm or appeal.
meanings.sent1: The seduced cat purred contentedly in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent2: The seduced audience clapped enthusiastically at the performance.
meanings.sent3: The seduced puppy wagged its tail happily at the sight of treats.
meanings.sent4: The seduced child smiled brightly at the colorful toy.
meanings.sent5: The seduced flower bloomed beautifully under the warm sunlight.
